titlestmt.titleproper: Drinker, Sophie Hutchinson, 1888-1967. Papers, 1917-1967: A Finding Aid

titlepage.titleproper: Drinker, Sophie Hutchinson, 1888-1967. Papers, 1917-1967: A Finding Aid
titlepage.author: Arthur and Elizabeth Schlesinger Library on the History of Women in America

did.abstract: Correspondence, etc., of Sophie Hutchinson Drinker, musician, civic volunteer, historian, author, and feminist.

acqinfo.p: The collection of Sophie Drinker, wife of Henry S. Drinker of the Drinker Library of Choral Music, and national consultant of the Schlesinger Library, 1955-1967, was received in April, 1968.

prefercite.p: Sophie Hutchinson Drinker. Papers, 1917-1967; item description, dates. 1351, folder #. Schlesinger Library, Radcliffe Institute, Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass.

scopecontent.head: SCOPE AND CONTENT
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of notes and articles on women's participation in music, music for women's chorus, and notes and glass lantern slides on goddesses and priestesses. Also included is a thesis by Mary Milbank Brown on goddesses in music.
